issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Bogus Error Message when trying to delete security group that has a resource using it (i.e. running instance in security group)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Bogus Error Message when creating security group that already exists

comments.body: Confirmed. *Steps to Reproduce* * Create security group * After successfully creation of security group, re-try security group creation and observe the error. *Error with debugging* Hi All,

May I please request a code review for : EUCA-5430 Bogus Error Message when creating security group that already exists

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-5430

diff :  git show --color 14dafb13610e56262e2f41d175f884fb6ad5365a

Summary: The error message that is throw for a duplicate security group is inconsistent with AWS 
         out put for the same error.  


Solution: check for DuplicateMetadataException and trow an error that is consistent with AWS out put 
 

Unit test :
Try and create the same security group twice and look at the error output:

[d-30:~]euca-create-group testGroup -d 'test'
GROUP	sg-12C03DFD	testGroup	test
[d-30:~]euca-create-group testGroup -d 'test'
euca-create-group: error (CreateSecurityGroupType): The security group 'testGroup' already exists
[d-30:~]  


I have created eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/3-3/Euca5430

Thx Mike

The fix does not use the error code ("Client.InvalidGroup.Duplicate") that AWS uses. If it is acceptable to have a nicer error that is not AWS compatible then we should create a new issue for the error code fix to ensure we address that in 3.4.0 along with other error clean up.
I think that the 'error code' issue is a much larger one as our current 'error codes' reflect the response types as opposed to the error cause.

[~hspencer] are you satisfied with this fix for this particular issue?  I mean now we have a better message when trying to create a duplicate security group *BUT* it is not conformant with the error code that AWS uses. As [~sjones] points out another issue can be created for fixing the actual error code.

{code}
[root@c-25 ~]# euca-create-group test-dup-fix -d "Test Security Group"
GROUP	sg-347E405B	test-dup-fix	Test Security Group
[root@c-25 ~]# euca-create-group test-dup-fix -d "Test Security Group"
euca-create-group: error (CreateSecurityGroupType): The security group 'test-dup-fix' already exists
{code}
There is already another bug created for this EUCA-6535 that is a much larger issue that needs to be addressed.

Consider this issue fixed. As [~mmunn1] commented there is already an issue for inconsistent with AWS error codes: EUCA-6535

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.3.1
Release     : 0.0.1110.20130702git95399f3e.el6
[~tony] and [~mmunn1], looks good to me.  Thanks for the hard work.
